channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Mary Ward
item.description: State border controls are in the spotlight after Victoria recorded 73 cases on Monday, its lowest daily total since July 3.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: Victorian COVID-19 cases in decline as health alerts issued for multiple Sydney venues; Australian death toll stands at 652

item.dc:creator: Latika Bourke
item.description: Liberal MP Tim Wilson says airlines are "gouging" Australians stranded overseas and trying to return home.
item.title: 'Exploitative and despicable': Government MP attacks airlines, international travel caps

item.dc:creator: Toby Crockford
item.description: All prisons from the NSW border up to and including Rockhampton are in lockdown under stage four restrictions due to COVID-19.
item.title: More fires at Arthur Gorrie Correctional Centre after initial blaze injures six

item.description: The unnamed Defence Ministry official said the strikes targeted military posts south of Damascus adding that Syrian air defences shot down most of the missiles.
item.title: Syria says Israeli missile strike kills, wounds soldiers

item.description: The Sydneysider has got a reduced Australian contingent off to a good start in New York.
item.title: Jordan Thompson leads Australian charge at US Open

item.description: The blooper came at a particularly trying time for WikiLeaks, whose jailed founder Julian Assange is fighting extradition from Britain to the United States.
item.title: WikiLeaks, key player in 2016 US election, suffers brief outage

item.description: While the S&P boasted its steepest August percentage gain in more than three decades it ended the day lower as investors took a pause although tech stars Apple and Tesla rallied.
item.title: ASX set to fall as Wall Street slides lower; Apple, Tesla surge

item.dc:creator: Bevan Shields
item.description: Lawyers have also hit out at an "obstruction and disinformation" campaign deployed by the Russian government.
item.title: Grieving MH17 families to request compensation out of landmark criminal trial

item.description: Warren Buffett's Berkshire Hathaway bought stakes in five of Japan's biggest trading companies, underscoring his willingness to bet on economically sensitive companies despite the pandemic.
item.title: Warren Buffett goes against grain with $8b bet on Japan

item.description: "This President long ago forfeited any moral leadership in this country," Biden said from a converted steel mill in Pittsburgh.
item.title: Joe Biden blames Donald Trump for sowing chaos amid crises

item.dc:creator: Clancy Yeates
item.description: Latitude Financial is exploring expansion into China, as it looks to accelerate growth by targeting the region's fast-growing middle class.
item.title: Latitude Financial keeps float dream alive, eyes Asian expansion

item.description: Avoiding caffeine after midday and eating more lentils, oats and fish are just some of the ways you can improve gut health and regulate your circadian rhythm.
item.title: How to eat your way to better sleep? First, ditch the 3pm 'pick me up'

item.description: At the present trajectory, India's coronavirus outbreak will eclipse Brazil's in about a week, and the US in about two months.
item.title: India is becoming the world's new coronavirus epicentre

item.description: The decision keeps the matter at least temporarily alive and rebuffs efforts by both Flynn's lawyers and the Justice Department to force the prosecution to be dropped.
item.title: Appeals court keeps Michael Flynn case alive, won't order dismissal

item.description: With about 100 metres to go, Ewan trailed five other riders before slinging himself through a narrow slice of road near the advertising barriers to claim victory.
item.title: Australian Caleb Ewan wins Tour de France third stage with sprint finish

item.description: Paul Rusesabagina, portrayed in the film Hotel Rwanda as a hero who saved the lives of more than 1200 people from the country's 1994 genocide, has been arrested by the Rwandan government.
item.title: Hotel Rwanda hero arrested on terrorism charges, police say

item.dc:creator: Melissa Cunningham
item.description: Dozens of requests for emergency accommodation from Victorians infected with coronavirus, including some who are homeless and others with complex medical needs, have been rejected
item.title: Vulnerable COVID-infected people turned away from hotel quarantine

item.dc:creator: Cathy Sherry
item.description: Governments have never understood that private citizens cannot be given unlimited power to run their own communities.
item.title: 'A dog's breakfast': NSW strata by-laws need to catch up to the 21st century

item.dc:creator: Peter FitzSimons
item.description: Time and again we are seeing public officials actually say memorable stuff, in clear language, simply because the stakes are so high.
item.title: We're getting more Blam! Blam! and less Blah Blah from public officials. Keep it coming!

item.description: No one wants a "third wave", but travel exemptions may not put us at risk while boosting the economy.
item.title: When state borders are used as tools against us it's time to consider scrapping them

item.dc:creator: Kate McClymont
item.description: Canterbury League Club has declined to take action against club chairman George Coorey following allegations of lewd comments raised by a number of women.
item.title: Leagues club declined to take action against chairman George Coorey

item.dc:creator: Chris Barrett
item.description: Locked in a dispute with Seven over the network's fears of a BBL talent drain, CA is planning to help teams pay overseas stars above and beyond the salary cap.
item.title: Big cash league: Cricket Australia's bid to draw world's best to BBL

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Aviation group Regional Express has managed to ride out the coronavirus storm, recording no net loss in revenue in fiscal 2020 thanks to government handouts.
item.title: Rex's airline miracle: revenue grows thanks to government handouts

item.dc:creator: Stuart Layt
item.description: A dedicated unit will be set up to deal with border exemption requests for medical emergencies, as the state records one new case linked to the current cluster.
item.title: Queensland plays down border issue as cluster cases level off

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Rumours of Kieran Foran's return to Manly are gathering, but it could all depend on Dylan Walker's future.
item.title: Foran Manly return hinges on player moving the other way

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: Critics say the redevelopment process was "eerily reminiscent" of that for the Bennelong Apartments, the building commonly referred to as "The Toaster" which was constructed on the eastern side of Circular Quay in the 1990s.
item.title: 'Like the Opera House': Calls for public design competition for Circular Quay

item.description: Josh Frydenberg's confected outrage over Victoria's ongoing and necessary lockdown is a feckless attempt to distract from the federal government's own woes.
item.title: Frydenberg's faux fury a 'disingenuous' diversion

item.dc:creator: Lucy Stone
item.description: Pedestrians struck by e-scooters may have difficulties in getting financial compensation for any injuries.
item.title: 'I had no idea what had hit me': Scooter insurance gap leaves pedestrians at risk

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: The head of Australia's cyber spy agency will declare it has been collecting intelligence on Australians for at least 20 years.
item.title: 'Not all Australians are the good guys': Citizens in cyber spy agency's sights

item.dc:creator: Cara Waters
item.description: US-based e-commerce company Zebit is looking to raise $US30 million ($42 million) from investors, as it looks to cash in on the the buy now, pay later craze.
item.title: Zebit prepares to join the ASX-listed buy now, pay later club

item.description: Students at The Australian Ballet School are considering repeating a year, because the pandemic robbed them of vital experience and opportunities.
item.title: With stages dark, ballet students fear to take the next leap

item.dc:creator: Anthony Galloway
item.description: The Chinese Communist Party’s use of coercive diplomacy against foreign governments and companies, including in Australia, has drastically increased over the past three years.
item.title: China ramps up coercive diplomacy as Australian winemakers hit twice

item.description: Free daily horoscope for each star sign from renowned Astrologer Hedy Damari. Forecasts for the day ahead in life, love and career.
item.title: Your Daily Horoscope for Tuesday, September 1

item.dc:creator: Bruce Wolpe
item.description: Trump is more popular now than were the last two one-term presidents.
item.title: Midnight in America: The true state of play in the US election is about to unfold

item.dc:creator: Stephanie Bull
item.description: Madame Bella Pevsner has made an appeal for funds for the settlement of Jewish pioneers in Palestine.
item.title: In the Herald: September 1, 1923

item.description: Despite his paintings selling for high prices, Ian Fairweather chose the life of a hermit, his home a makeshift hut without electricity or running water.
item.title: From the Archives, 1970: He hangs in the Tate Gallery... and lives in a grass hut

item.dc:creator: Matt O'Sullivan
item.description: The state government is under pressure from councils to ensure funding grants are handed out in a fair and equitable manner to guarantee public confidence in the programs.
item.title: Spotlight to be put on state's grants programs for councils

item.dc:creator: Melissa Singer
item.description: What do you do when you have so many clothes and yet so few places to where them? Easy: you improvise.
item.title: The case for dressing up with nowhere to go

item.description: Trivia buffs: test your knowledge with today's interactive superquiz and target.
item.title: Target and superquiz, Tuesday, September 1

item.dc:creator: Nick Miller
item.description: It's important for people to get used to paying for performances online, says the Yarra Valley Opera Festival artistic director.
item.title: Modern opera festival moves from the Valley to the digital frontier

item.dc:creator: Colin Kruger
item.description: This column owes an apology to the celebrity chef.
item.title: Adam Liaw on the road with a very full Esky

item.dc:creator: Harriet Alexander
item.description: One of Australia's top mental health advisers wants to exploit the pandemic to shift the way that mental health is perceived and funded.
item.title: How the lessons of the pandemic could be used to prevent suicide

item.description: After so much sacrifice, Victorians don’t want to find themselves back here in lockdown again. Here's what they will need to do.
item.title: How Victoria can leave lockdown, safely, and avoid a return

item.description: Even in a pandemic stasis, time marches on and seasons fade and flourish.
item.title: Our world may be turned upside down but hope springs eternal

item.description: The news of the day as interpreted by our talented artists, illustrators and cartoonists.
item.title: Best of cartoons, September 1, 2020

item.dc:creator: Dana McCauley
item.description: New data reveals a federal agency did not enforce national infection prevention standards in some homes until tragically late.
item.title: Aged care regulator 'too late to act' in enforcing standards

item.description: Football champion Danny Frawley was suffering from the neurodegenerative disease caused by repeated blows to the head when he died, according to an analysis of his brain handed to the coroner.
item.title: Danny Frawley was suffering from chronic brain disease when he died

item.description: The finest photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.
item.title: The best of the world in pictures

item.dc:creator: Eryk Bagshaw
item.description: The high-profile journalist, who has been an anchor for Chinese state media network CGTN-News since 2013, was detained on August 14.
item.title: Australian TV anchor Cheng Lei detained in China

item.dc:creator: Mike Foley
item.description: Legally binding national standards will be added to proposed changes to the EPBC Act after they were a glaring omission from a bill last week.
item.title: Environment law will add national standards after bill cops heavy criticism
